abstract: Federation of Protestant Welfare Agencies, one of eight agencies supported by New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, helps Wilkenson Joseph by giving him $1,000 grant to purchase furniture after he was able to find permanent housing.

headline.print_headline: Finding a Home in the Bronx After Escaping Anti-Gay Violence in Haiti
headline.main: Finding a Home in the Bronx After Fleeing Anti-Gay Violence in Haiti

keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Wilkenson Joseph came to the United States after enduring attacks because of his sexuality. Unable to work without a new visa, he found himself on the streets....
lead_paragraph: Wilkenson Joseph came to the United States after enduring attacks because of his sexuality. Unable to work without a new visa, he found himself on the streets.
